Class Searcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • Searcher

  • public class Searcher
extends java.lang.Object
    The Searcher class instantiates an IndexSearcher, QueryParser, IndexReader, and an array. The Searcher class makes it possible for users to search the index. The "public" folder is public to all people viewing the website. Otherwise, the Searcher class will check permissions.
    Author:
    Gina

    • Method Detail

      • searchIndex

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> searchIndex(org.json.JSONObject json,
                                                         java.lang.String indexDir,
                                                         java.lang.String number,
                                                         java.lang.String email)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        The searchIndex function is triggered from the Server_Socket. It will search the indexed files for relevant search results, taking into account synonyms and givng a boost if the search term matches a key term or a file name.
        Parameters:
        json - JSON object sent from the searcher with information about the particular query.
        indexDir - The directory where the index of the files are stored.
        number - Number of hits
        email - Email of the user
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of strings with the search results in HTML
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • synonymfind

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> synonymfind(java.lang.String synword)
        Finds synonyms using the WordNet database
        Parameters:
        synword - Word that needs synonyms
        Returns:
        ArrayList of synonyms

      • checkPermission

        public static boolean checkPermission(java.lang.String path,
                                      java.lang.String email)
                               throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                      java.sql.SQLException
        Checks if the user has permission to view the file by checking the MySQL database
        Parameters:
        path - Filepath attempting to be viewed
        email - Email of the user
        Returns:
        Boolean true/false
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException
